content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is an example of how you could write this function in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Use regex to match the code blocks and their contents
    matches = eachmatch(r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```", md, seperators=["\n"])

    # Concatenate all matching strings together with a newline
    return join([match[1] for match in matches], "\n")
end
```

The regex pattern `r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```" is used to match the code blocks. The part `.*?` is a lazy match which will match as few characters as possible (non-greedy) before matching `\n```. This is necessary to correctly handle multiple consecutive code blocks in different languages since the engine would stop at the first closing triple backticks (````), even if there are more code blocks following.

Please note that this function assumes that markdown syntax for code fences (i.e., lines of text surrounded by three backticks) is used, and that all code blocks in the provided string `md` are indeed Julia blocks.
